text: Humberstone is a ghost town in the Atacama of Chile. It is a Chilean National Monument and part of a UNESCO World Heritage Site. ==History== The town was founded as "La Palma" in 1872 for workers at the adjacent potassium nitrate extraction plant of the Peruvian Nitrate Company. James Thomas Humberstone later became the CEO of the Peruvian Nitrate Company. ==Notes and references== ==External links== Category:Mines in Chile Category:Atacama Desert Category:Ghost towns in South America Category:Populated places in Tarapacá Region Category:Protected areas of Tarapacá Region Category:National Monuments of Chile
title: Humberstone, Chile
